webscript.description:
Web Script that returns some data about a Synced Node on a sync-target Alfresco instance.

The nodeRef query parameter should refer to a valid NodeRef in the local repository. Normally the response body will be of the form: 

   {
      "remoteNetworkId": "alfresco.com",
      "remoteNodeRef": "workspace://SpacesStore/9bc01309-8112-406b-b614-fd70bf3d83e2",
      "remoteParentNodeRef": "workspace://SpacesStore/9bc01309-8112-406b-b614-fd70bf3d83e2",
      "localRootNodeRef": "workspace://SpacesStore/9bc01309-8112-406b-b614-fd70bf3d83e2",
      "localRootNodeName": "Testfolder",
      "syncSetOwnerFirstName": "Joe",
      "syncSetOwnerLastName": "Soap",
      "syncSetOwnerUserName": "jsoap"
   }
If the local nodeRef does not exist, the webscript will return a 404. If the local nodeRef is not a member of a SyncSet, the webscript will return a 403. If the local nodeRef is a member of a SyncSet, but does not have a record of its partner NodeRef (e.g. because it has not yet been synced), then the remoteNodeRef value will be the empty string.
